subject: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
Boxing
lead_paragraph: The former heavyweight Scott LeDoux, 60, has Lou Gehrig’s disease, also known as amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. It is a normally fatal disease that cripples the body and takes away the ability to speak, but LeDoux said he will not let the diagnosis stop him from living a full life. LeDoux has continued his work as a commissioner in Anoka County — a suburban county north of Minneapolis — and as the executive director of the Minnesota Combative Sports Commission.
